DM instance that illustrates top-level types and in-place types.

Data Types

The parameters defined in this specification make use of a limited subset of the default SOAP data types [SOAP1.1]. The complete set of data types, along with the notation used to represent these types, is listed in [Appendix I.4/TR-106a7]. The following named data types are used by this specification.

Data Type Base Type Description
Milliamps unsignedInt

Current measured in milliamps.

XXX 1: Should be able to use the units template here.

XXX 2: Maybe needs to be signed?
Millivolts unsignedInt

Voltage measured in millivolts.

XXX 3: Maybe needs to be signed?
Percentage unsignedInt[0:100] Percentage.

References

[SOAP1.1] Simple Object Access Protocol (SOAP) 1.1, W3C.
[TR-106a7] TR-106 Amendment 7, Data Model Template for TR-069-Enabled Devices, Broadband Forum, 2013.

TypeHier:1.0 Data Model

Name Type Write Description Object Default Version
Device. object - Top-level object. - 1.0
LightNumberOfEntries unsignedInt - The number of entries in the Light table. - 1.0
FanNumberOfEntries unsignedInt - The number of entries in the Fan table. - 1.0
CeilingFanNumberOfEntries unsignedInt - The number of entries in the CeilingFan table. - 1.0
Device.Light.{i}. object -

All lights.

At most one entry in this table can exist with a given value for Name.

 - 1.0
type string -

Comma-separated list of strings (maximum item length 64). Object type (base type and derived types). Each list item is an enumeration of:

  • Light
  • PowerSensor
  • PowerSensor.Powerable
  • Switchable
  • Dimmable

XXX 4: Note that use of lower-case initial letter guarantees no conflict with other parameter names.

XXX 5: The DM Schema and BBF Report Tool have been modified to allow enumeration values to be appended.

 - 1.0
Name string­(64) - Instance name. - 1.0
Device.Light.{i}.PowerSensor. object -

Power sensor behavior.

XXX 6: MUST each derived type live in its own separate object (it's a simple rule but it clutters the data model)? Also, MUST the object have the same name as the type (type names are not necessarily natural object names)?

 - 1.0
StartMeasurement command - Start taking a power measurement. - 1.0
StopMeasurement command - Stop taking a power measurement. - 1.0
Device.Light.{i}.PowerSensor.Powerable. object - Powerable behavior. - 1.0
Voltage unsignedInt - [Millivolts] Voltage. - 1.0
Current unsignedInt - [Milliamps] Current. - 1.0
Device.Light.{i}.Switchable. object - Switchable behavior. - 1.0
State boolean - Whether currently switched on. - 1.0
On command - Switch on. - 1.0
Off command - Switch off. - 1.0
Toggle command - Toggle the on/off state. - 1.0
Device.Light.{i}.Dimmable. object -

Dimmable behavior.

XXX 7: Need to change the semantics of min:max = 0:1 (it's no longer union semantics).

This object is a member of a union, i.e. it is a member of a group of objects of which only one can exist at a given time.

 - 1.0
CurrentLevel unsignedInt­[0:100] - [Percentage] Current dimmer level. - 1.0
SetLevel command - Set the dimmer level. - 1.0
# Input object -   - 1.0
# Level unsignedInt­[0:100] - [Percentage] Requested new dimmer level. - 1.0

Device.CeilingFan.{i}. object -

All fans.

At most one entry in this table can exist with a given value for Name.

 - 1.0
type string -

Comma-separated list of strings (maximum item length 64). Object type (base type and derived types). Each list item is an enumeration of:

  • CeilingFan

XXX 11: Note that use of lower-case initial letter guarantees no conflict with other parameter names.

XXX 12: The DM Schema and BBF Report Tool have been modified to allow enumeration values to be appended.

XXX 13: Not necessary to have explicit type because don't expect derived types?

 - 1.0
Light string -

The value MUST be the path name of a row in the Light table. If the referenced object is deleted, the parameter value MUST be set to an empty string.

XXX 14: BBF Report Tool issue? Parameter order isn't preserved. Name comes after Light and Fan.

 - 1.0
Fan string - The value MUST be the path name of a row in the Fan table. If the referenced object is deleted, the parameter value MUST be set to an empty string. - 1.0
Name string­(64) - Instance name. - 1.0

Profile Definitions

Notation

The following abbreviations are used to specify profile requirements:

Abbreviation Description
R Read support is REQUIRED.
W Both Read and Write support is REQUIRED. This MUST NOT be specified for a parameter that is defined as read-only.
P The object is REQUIRED to be present.
C Creation and deletion of instances of the object via AddObject and DeleteObject is REQUIRED.
A Creation of instances of the object via AddObject is REQUIRED, but deletion is not REQUIRED.
D Deletion of instances of the object via DeleteObject is REQUIRED, but creation is not REQUIRED.
